issue.subject: Foreign key error when country not set in organisation adress
issue.description:
When saving an easysdi user without setting the country in adress, there is a foreign key error : 
Cannot add or update a child row: a foreign key constraint fails (`bdt32`.`bdt32_sdi_address`, CONSTRAINT `bdt32_sdi_address_fk5` FOREIGN KEY (`country_id`) REFERENCES `bdt32_sdi_sys_country` (`id`)) SQL=UPDATE `bdt32_sdi_address` SET `guid`='2c7a5746-47b2-8234-69c2-d1c60564de91',`alias`='_3',`created_by`='633',`created`='2016-02-23 10:52:23',`modified_by`='633',`modified`='2016-02-23 10:52:23',`ordering`=NULL,`state`='1',`checked_out`='0',`checked_out_time`='2016-02-23 10:52:23',`user_id`='2',`organism_id`=NULL,`addresstype_id`='1',`civility`='',`firstname`='',`lastname`='',`function`='',`address`='',`addresscomplement`='',`postalcode`='',`postalbox`='',`locality`='',`country_id`='0',`phone`='',`mobile`='',`fax`='',`email`='',`sameascontact`='1' WHERE `id`='16'


country_id should be set to NULL and not to '0'. Are you ok with this Yves?

journals.notes:
Perfectly right.
I'll correct it right now
